marklogic.body: I'm finding fewer and fewer things to disagree with in your posts; this is good! You say we're not sycophants, which I don't contest, but I don't think NOT insulting someone's intelligence because they were rude, qualifies you as a sheep. In fact I think the opposite is true, and the opposite happened. I think a lot of sheep, or lemmings, if you will, followed the leader Off the cliff. Now I want to link to a site I frequent for its guest list updates and its often interesting discussions: The Activity Pit. http://activitypit.ning.com/forum/topics/Red-eye-... This is the discussion about the episode that sparked the podcast. Of all the negative comments about McEnany, how many are blatant and don't give a reason? All of about one or two. I get that on Twitter it's tough to get a cogent critique of something someone said into a tweet, but you only see a couple rude negative comments. I wish the guys read the Pit more often! Maybe they do but they don't talk about it because, as you say (here I plug one of your points!), they focus on the negative which they can easy find on Twitter.
